column4: I get this error, when I try to remove a package: "The package 'printers-bangalore' is in an inconsistent state and needs to be reinstalled, but no archive can be found for it. Please reinstall the package manually or remove it from the system."
I want to remove it from the system
that package is not an ubuntu created package
speak to the people who created it
speak to your sys admin, so he can verify how it will effect your system
I have unziped the package and i know that it wont affect my system. I am trying to do it myself ( to learn) and the reason I installed package was to setup the printer.
still best to speak to your sys admin, I'm sure he will teach you but teach you safley
Sorry to bother you;please dont let me in rounds. If you know the howto, please share;  there should be reason as why I am trying so hard.. :) you get it?
your system administrator is the best way - if there is a reason you won't speak to your system administrator can't help you please tell me
ssl headers have nothing to do with this package
ok - so then it DOES have implications to other packages - speak to your system administrator
you will potentially do serious damage to your system playing with a custom pacakge that has dependencies on other pacakges

I am not worried about that. :) I am kind of surprised at your send me in so many rounds.  ikonia; I am a programmer,  who can try out stuffs and experiement too. This package was a experiement which has failed; and I am trying to undo it..
the package should not just be blindly removed if it has dependencies on other packages, hence why you should talk to your systems administrator
